content.description: Start on the slab skirt and clip the belayers bolt. Make your way on to a questionable flake for the second bolt. Good, slightly hidden pockets on slab make up the remaining bolts. Move right through the small crack and go up over the ledge for the chains.
content.location: Near the left river access on Painted Canyon Sector.

content.description: Adventure style climb through sharp plants. Cruxes are at the start (for shorter climbers) and near the top.
content.location: This route is on the rightmost side of Painted Canyon Sector and is directly right of the Spice right.  These routes are listed together as Sugar & Spice in the topo.

content.description: Crux is getting past the bulge, I'd recommend going left.
content.location: Painted Canyon. Look for the white lichen covered wall and obvious bulge.

content.description: Some chirping within the flake that might make the climb a little harder if you have a fear of bats. There are some crimps, sidepulls off the flake, and pumpy moves towards the end, which makes it a fun route with a variety of moves. Probably a 10-, but listed as a 10+ in the route map.
content.protection: Chains at top. Take about 10 draws.
content.location: Large flake with a block roof next to the corner. It's about 25 meters right of Piranha and about 100m left of Crackalicious. Immediately left of Frozen Spark, and some bolts may appear to be part of Shake N' Flake, but are actually off of Frozen Spark's route.

content.description: Start on the slab skirt and clip the belayers bolt shared with Turtle Lasso to the left. Move towards the undercut/cave feature for some good underclings to clip the first bolt on the face. Crux one is pulling up on sharp small pockets to the right of the first face bolt, with marginal feet. Another good pocket allows for clipping the second bolt. A bit of a run out with committing feet leads to a jug for clipping the third bolt. Pull some easier slab moves and move up towards the left for the last bolt. Pull the ledge for the anchors (shared with Turtle Lasso).
content.location: Second bolt line to the right of the orange L flake.

content.description: Crux is after the large ledge to the smaller ledge. There's a bush in the way that makes the grade seem a lot more difficult.
content.protection: Fixed bolts at top - rope might get stuck when cleaning due to angle of the bolts to belay station
content.location: Furthest bolted route in the Painted Canyon area. Look for the large calcium deposit cave and it'll be about 10 feet to the right.

climbs.name: Picnic
climbs.fa: Tommy Blackwell and Bill Horton Jan.29,2022

content.description: Nice 5.7 with a bonus.6 gluein bolts to sport anchors with  7th bolt to the right of the anchors to allow the leader to bring up the second and enjoy a roomy picnic alcove.Interesting features, huge holds on good rock.
content.protection: 6 Glueins to sport anchors with a 7th bolt at the anchors
content.location: GPS 29.813582, -101.438443Located 50 yards to the right of Sugar and Spice.See photos for location info

content.description: An interesting crack/face climb. There is a 10 variation the goes left and up the face near the beginning of the roof crack (where the large flake ends), you should be able to see a couple bolts.
content.protection: It's bolted with anchors on a nice ledge. Beware of rope drag, bring a couple alpine draws if you have them. Also, be prepared to clean.
content.location: Should be the first large crack system that you encounter as you walk upstream, look for the short roof crack (large flake).

content.description: The name says it all, it's a popular climb for a reason.
content.protection: It's bolted with anchors (steel rings). Be prepared to clean.
content.location: Look for a large crack system towards the end of the wall. It's just up river from Over Under Sideways Down, which has a short roof crack section.

content.description: Some great moderate to difficult climbs of a decent length.Nice shady wall!
